trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem"></xref> objects in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control.

The DataGridItemCollection class represents a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> objects, which in turn represent the data items in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.

To programmatically retrieve <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> objects from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control, use one of following methods: - Use the indexer to get a single <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> object from the collection, using array notation.

- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the contents of the collection to a <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName>, which can then be used to get items from the collection.

- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> interface, which can then be used to get items from the collection.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection.Count%2A> property specifies the total number of items in the collection and is commonly used to determine the upper bound of the collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection> class.
A <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> that contains the items with which to initialize the collection.

Copies all the items from this <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection"></xref> collection to the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName>, starting at the specified index in the <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName>.

Use this method to copy the contents of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection> collection into the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName>, starting at the specified index.
> [!NOTE] > The `array` parameter must be a zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName>.
A zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> that receives the copied items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection"></xref>.
The first position in the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> to receive the copied contents.
Gets the number of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem"></xref> objects in the collection.
Use the Count property to determine the number of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection> collection.
The Count property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine the upper bound of the collection.
The number of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem"></xref> objects in the collection.

Returns a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName>-implemented object that contains all the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection"></xref> collection.

Use this method to create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName>-implemented object that can be iterated through to get each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection> collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to get the item currently pointed to in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move to the next item in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to its initial position.

> [!NOTE] > After you create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName>-implemented object or use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is undefined.

A <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName>-implemented object that contains all <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection"></xref>.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection"></xref> collection can be modified.
This property always returns `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection> collection can be written to in all cases.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> in all cases.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection"></xref> collection is synchronized (thread-safe).
This property is derived from the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface and is overridden to always return `false`.

For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> in all cases.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem"></xref> object at the specified index in the collection.

Use this indexer to get a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection> collection at the specified index, using array notation.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem"></xref> to retrieve from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem"></xref> at the specified index in the collection.
Gets the object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection"></xref> collection.
The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection> object itself.

For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
A <xref:System.Object?displayProperty=fullName> that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
